english: wheat; grain; to sell; to advise

etymology.description: 麦(麥) (mài, "wheat") is a combination of phonetic 來(來) (lái, "to come") and semantic 夊(夊) (sū, "to walk slowly; footprint pointing down").
etymology.interpretation: This character conveys the idea of wheat developing from something heavenly or miraculous. 麦 emphasizes the importance of wheat as a staple food source, symbolizing nourishment.

parts.english: to walk slowly; footprint pointing down

examples.chinese: 我们需要买一些麦(麥)子。
examples.english: We need to buy some wheat.

examples.pinyin: zhè mài(zǐ) zhǎng dé hěn hǎo。
examples.english: This wheat is growing very well.
